cards.title: Account and Workspace Setup
items: Create your manager account and verify email
Invite staff and assign manager, staff, or admin permissions
Pick a profession template (salon, recruiter, fitness, real estate, photography, etc.)
Connect Stripe for payouts, checkout, and card-on-file (required for live transactions)

cards.title: Company Profile and Branding
items: Configure business hours, tax settings, and currency
Upload logos, theme colors, booking widgets, and notifications
Link an existing custom domain; in-app domain purchase is coming soon

cards.title: Operational Foundations
items: Build services, add-ons, departments, and branch catalogs
Publish availability templates, recurring schedules, and shift rotations
Enable Stripe Tax to automate tax calculations for products and add-ons
Review notification defaults, reminders, and marketing campaigns

cards.title: Booking and Scheduling
highlights: Service catalog setup with durations, buffers, and add-ons
Recurring availability and editable slots (Vagaro-style)
Profession templates with tailored emails and questionnaires
Branch or department-specific booking flows
Clients get confirmations, reminders, tips, reviews, and memberships

cards.title: Payroll and HR
highlights: Employee profiles with pay rates, roles, and compliance notes
Timesheet approvals, batch payroll, and overrides
Shift swap requests and leave approvals with manager review
Overtime, holidays, and bonuses calculated automatically
Exports ready for 45 U.S. states + all Canadian provinces (except QC)

cards.title: Website Builder
highlights: Industry-specific templates with hero, reviews, and contact pages
Instant theme customization for colors, fonts, navigation
Version history, visual editor, and auto-publishing
Custom domain linking (in-app purchase coming soon)

cards.title: Commerce and Products
highlights: Mixed carts for services, products, and add-ons via Stripe Checkout
Coupons, gift cards, refunds, and Stripe Tax automation
Save card on file and manage payouts through Stripe
Track order history, reconciled refunds, and revenue per location

cards.title: Analytics and Reporting
highlights: Monitor revenue, retention, utilization, and churn
Drill into providers, departments, and campaigns
Advanced dashboards for tips, refunds, and marketing
Export reports to CSV or connect to BI tools

cards.title: Automations and Integrations
highlights: Configure outbound webhooks with signature verification
Trigger emails, SMS, and win-back campaigns automatically
Stripe for payments, payouts, and tax automation
QuickBooks/Xero exports; Jitsi for virtual sessions
Zapier, Slack notifications, and in-app domains coming soon

items.question: How long does onboarding take?
items.answer: Most teams launch within 7-14 days using the quick-start checklists and import templates in the docs.

items.question: Can clients purchase both services and products?
items.answer: Yes. Clients can add multiple services, add-ons, or merchandise items to their cart and complete checkout securely through Stripe.

items.question: Do you support Zapier or custom webhooks?
items.answer: Webhooks are fully supported. Zapier integration is in development for later 2025.

items.question: Do you offer data migration?
items.answer: Yes. Contact support for CSV import templates or request managed migration for an additional fee.

quickbooks.title: Schedulaa + QuickBooks setup guide
quickbooks.summary: Map once, validate the chips, and sync payroll or revenue exports with a single click.
quickbooks.quickLinkDescription: Mapping, defaults, cost centers, and export guardrails.

sections.heading: Prerequisites
items: Use QuickBooks Essentials, Plus, or Advanced to expose customer lists (Simple Start sandboxes do not).
Enable Classes and Locations if you plan to tag Schedulaa departments as cost centers.
Create or reuse the wage, liability, and revenue accounts you plan to map (income tax, CPP/EI, FICA/Medicare, tips payable, net pay, service/product revenue, and sales tax).

sections.heading: 1. Why mapping is required
items: QuickBooks accepts journals only when every category—wages, deductions, FICA/Medicare, net pay, revenue, tax, tips—points to a real account.
Schedulaa uses those mappings to build balanced debit/credit lines; when the chips turn green, Sync to QuickBooks is ready.

sections.heading: 2. How mapping works
items: Under Payroll and Revenue mapping, choose the exact account codes from your QuickBooks chart.
Need a new account? Create it in QuickBooks and click Refresh (or reconnect) so it appears in the dropdown.
Mappings can be edited at any time—future exports automatically use the new accounts.

sections.heading: 3. Recommended accounts
items: Expenses: Wages & Salaries, Holiday/Vacation Pay, Tips Paid, Sales Commissions.
Liabilities: Income tax payable, CPP/QPP payable, EI payable, FICA payable (U.S.), Medicare payable (U.S.), Tips payable.
Net pay: Payroll Checking or a dedicated payroll clearing account so the journal balances.
Revenue: Service Income, Product Sales, Sales Tax Payable, Tips Payable.

sections.heading: 4. Exporting payroll
items: Finalize the pay run in Schedulaa, load it in Payroll Preview, and click Sync to QuickBooks.
Schedulaa posts a balanced Journal Entry (wages/vacation/tips/commissions debited; income tax, CPP/EI, FICA/Medicare, tips payable, and net pay credited).
Class/Location tags are attached automatically when departments are mapped.
No manual edits are required inside QuickBooks.
If you prefer Zapier-driven payroll workflows instead of native sync, add an Event hook for “When a payroll payment is requested” and handle journals/approvals in Zapier.

sections.heading: 5. Exporting revenue, invoices, and sales receipts
items: Summarized revenue journal: export service revenue, product revenue, sales tax collected, and tips payable for any date range.
Invoices or Sales Receipts: set default Item/Customer, pick the document type and date range, and Schedulaa creates QuickBooks documents per transaction.
Every export stores the resulting QuickBooks ID on the transaction for audit trails.

sections.heading: 6. Locking periods and backdated exports
items: Use “Lock exports before” to prevent journals from posting into closed months.
Disable backdated exports if you want strict accounting controls; re-enable when finance approves a historical post.

sections.heading: 7. Integration Activity
items: Every export is logged with date, provider, type, status, external ID, and the manager who triggered it.
Check Workspace Settings → Integration Activity to confirm QuickBooks sync history or troubleshoot failures.

sections.heading: 8. Common questions
items: Do I need every account pre-created? No—map to existing accounts or create new ones in QuickBooks first, then refresh.
Can I change mappings later? Yes—future exports immediately use the new mapping.
Why is the Customer dropdown empty? Essentials/Plus/Advanced expose the list; Simple Start sandboxes do not.
Do payroll exports require customers? No—only invoice/sales receipt exports use CustomerRef.

sections.heading: 9. Quick setup checklist
items: Map payroll expenses and liabilities (including FICA/Medicare if U.S.).
Map net pay → bank, plus service/product revenue, tax, and tips payable.
Configure default Class/Location/Item/Customer (optional) and Departments ↔ Class/Location mappings.
Finalize payroll → Sync to QuickBooks → confirm success in Integration Activity.

sections.heading: 10. Success flow
items: Green status chips + lock-date guardrails enabled.
Integration Activity shows a success entry with ManualJournalID or Invoice ID.
Accounting can reconcile journals without editing them manually.

xero.title: Schedulaa + Xero setup guide
xero.summary: Map accounts, configure tracking defaults, and lock accounting periods before syncing Schedulaa payroll or revenue journals to Xero.
xero.quickLinkDescription: Manual journal mapping, tracking, and lock-date controls.

sections.heading: Prerequisites
items: Create or reuse the Xero expense/liability accounts you plan to map (wages, vacation, tips, commissions, income tax, CPP/EI, FICA/Medicare, tips payable, net pay, service/product revenue, tax collected).
Add Tracking Categories (e.g., Departments or Locations) with options for each branch if you plan to map Schedulaa departments.

sections.heading: 1. Why mapping is required
items: Xero accepts a manual journal only when every line—wages, deductions, FICA/Medicare, net pay, revenue, tax, tips—points to a real account.
Schedulaa builds those debit/credit lines automatically; green status chips indicate all required kinds are mapped.

sections.heading: 2. How mapping works
items: Under Payroll and Revenue mapping, choose the account code straight from your Xero chart.
Need a new account? Create it in Xero, reconnect or refresh, then map it here.
Mappings can be changed at any time—future exports reuse the most recent selections.

sections.heading: 3. Recommended accounts
items: Expenses: Wages & Salaries, Holiday/Vacation Pay, Tips Paid, Sales Commissions.
Liabilities: Income tax payable, CPP/QPP payable, EI payable, FICA payable (U.S.), Medicare payable (U.S.), Tips payable.
Net pay: Payroll clearing or your payroll bank account.
Revenue: Service Income, Product Sales, Sales Tax Payable, Tips Payable.

sections.heading: 4. Exporting payroll
items: Finalize payroll in Schedulaa, load the run, and click Sync to Xero.
Schedulaa sends a balanced journal (wages + employer portions + deductions + net pay + tips payable).
Tracking categories are attached per department or fall back to your default tracking selection.
If you want Zapier to orchestrate payroll instead of native sync, add an Event hook for “When a payroll payment is requested” and let Zapier create journals/approvals.

sections.heading: 5. Exporting revenue / sales
items: Use the revenue export card to push summarized service/product revenue, sales tax collected, and tips payable for a date range.
Each export stores the returned ManualJournalID so finance can audit the sync.

sections.heading: 6. Default tracking & lock date
items: Set a default tracking category + option so unmapped transactions still land in the correct cost center.
Use “Lock exports before” + “Allow backdated exports” to block journals from posting into closed periods.

sections.heading: 7. Departments ↔ Tracking
items: Map each Schedulaa department to a Xero tracking category option (e.g., Downtown Studio, York Mills).
During export, Schedulaa attaches the department’s tracking option; if none exist, it uses your default tracking.

sections.heading: 8. Common questions
items: Do I need every account pre-created? No—map to existing accounts or add new ones in Xero first, then refresh.
Can I change mappings later? Yes—future exports immediately use the updated mapping.
Not seeing tracking categories? Add them in Xero (Accounting → Accounting settings → Tracking categories) and click Refresh.

sections.heading: 9. Quick setup checklist
items: Map payroll expenses and liabilities (including FICA/Medicare for U.S. entities).
Map net pay, service/product revenue, tax collected, and tips payable.
Configure default tracking + lock date, then map departments ↔ tracking options.
Finalize payroll → Sync to Xero → confirm success in Integration Activity.
